data.name: RGB Colour changer
data.description:
# RGB Colour changer
Jon has an RGB colour (in hex form), such as `#ABC123`

He wants a slightly darker version of this colour, e.g. 10% darker.  
However, he cannot simply multiply the hex by 0.9, as it would give the wrong colour (due to the way the RGB hex is structred).

The RGB hex `#ABC123` is structured in the following way:

`#` is the Hex Identifier  
`AB` is the amount of Red  
`C1` is the amount of Green  
`23` is the amount of Blue

# Your task
Build a tool that converts this for Jon. It takes two parameters:

`rgb` is the Hex-String of the RGB colour (may be lowercase or uppercase)

`percent` is the percentage by which to make it darker. Negative percentages should make it lighter.  
If this parameter is not supplied, you should default to 10%.

# Important Notes
-The result must be a lowercase Hex-String  
-The result must be a valid RGB-Hex, i.e. it must not have values larger than 'FF' or smaller than '00' and be exactly 6 characters long (7 including the #)
